Package processor.utils

Class PatternValidationUtils

java.lang.Object
processor.utils.PatternValidationUtils
public class PatternValidationUtils extends Object
Utilities used in process of validating the use of design patterns.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs an utilities class and initialize attributes used further.

  • Constructor Details

    • PatternValidationUtils

      public PatternValidationUtils(ProcessingEnvironment processingEnv, String patternName)
      Constructs an utilities class and initialize attributes used further.
      Parameters:
      processingEnv - environment used during processing annotations.
      patternName - name of the pattern, used in error reports.

  • Method Details

    • validateHasElement

      public final void validateHasElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation, String elementName)
      Checks whether source class contains any element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation
      elementName - name of element that should be annotated, used in error report.

    • validateHasStaticElement

      public final void validateHasStaticElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation, String elementName)
      Checks whether source class contains any static element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation
      elementName - name of element that should be annotated, used in error report.

    • validateHasPrivateElement

      public final void validateHasPrivateElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation, String elementName)
      Checks whether source class contains any private element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation
      elementName - name of element that should be annotated, used in error report.

    • validateIsInterfaceOrAbstractClass

      public final void validateIsInterfaceOrAbstractClass(Element srcClass, String annotation)
      Checks whether source class is an interface or abstract class. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class that should be an interface or abstract class.
      annotation - annotation that implicates that class should be an interface or abstract class, used in error report.

    • validateIsConcreteClass

      public final void validateIsConcreteClass(Element srcClass, String annotation)
      Checks whether source class is a concrete class, which means not interface or abstract class. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class that should be a concrete class.
      annotation - annotation that implicates that class should be a concrete class, used in error report.

    • validateSomeSuperclassHasAnnotation

      @SafeVarargs public final void validateSomeSuperclassHasAnnotation(Element classElement, String classAnnotation, String superclassAnnotation, Class<? extends Annotation>... annotations)
      Checks whether the class is a subclass of some class annotated with given annotation. Reports an error if no. utils.validateSomeSuperclassHasAnnotation(e, "ConcreteHandler", "IHandler", ChainOfResponsibilityPattern.IHandler.class, ChainOfResponsibilityPattern.ConcreteHandler.class);
      Parameters:
      classElement - class that should be a subclass of some specific class.
      classAnnotation - name of annotation that implicates that class should be a subclass of some specific class, used in error report.
      superclassAnnotation - name of wanted annotation of superclass, used in error report.
      annotations - list of wanted annotations, from which at least one should occur

    • assertClassExists

      public void assertClassExists(int classCounter, String className)
      Assertion that parameter classCounter is not equal 0. If it is 0, reports an error.
      Parameters:
      classCounter - the number of occurrences of a given class annotation, which shouldn't be 0.
      className - the name of a class, used in error report.
